Module it.unipr.shopfx
Package it.unipr.warehouse

Class Warehouse

java.lang.Object
it.unipr.warehouse.Warehouse
public class Warehouse extends Object
The Warehouse class defines a warehouse object

An instance of Warhouse is capable of managing lists of Order objects and maps of Product objects, it can filter, check availability and add orders.

Since:
1.0
Version:
2.0
Author:
Tanzi Manuel, 307720, Mamone Maximiliano, 308214

    • addToMap

      public void addToMap(String s1, String s2)
      Method used to add an entry to the filter map, s1,s2 are respectively the key and the value to set

      In this particular class the method sets a particular filter if the user chooses to

      Parameters:
      s1 - String that contains the filter to add
      s2 - String that contains the value to use as a filter
      Since:
      1.0

      public HashMap<Product,Integer> filterProduct()

    • orderMap

      public HashMap<Product,Integer> orderMap(boolean desc, Map<Product,Integer> sortMap)
      Method that returns an ordered map of products based on the parameter boolean desc
      Parameters:
      desc - parameter that identifies if the map has to be ordered in descending or ascending order - true descending false ascending
      sortMap - paramater that must contain the map to order
      Returns:
      HashMap<Product, Integer> - sorted map
      Since:
      2.0

    • getProductById

      public Product getProductById(String id)
      Method that returns from the storage a product with an equal id to the one passed as parameter
      Parameters:
      id - parameter that identifies the product to look for
      Returns:
      Product - if it finds a correspondence it returns the found product otherwise it returns a new empty product
      Since:
      1.0

    • checkProduct

      public boolean checkProduct(String id, int quantity)
      Method that checks if a product is present in a certain quantity in the storage
      Parameters:
      id - parameter that identifies the product to look for
      quantity - parameter that identifies the quantity needed
      Returns:
      boolean - true if the product exists and there is enough of it, false otherwise
      Since:

      public boolean checkProductExist(String id)

      Parameters:

      Returns:
      boolean - true if the product is a key of the storage map, false otherwise

    • buyProduct

      public Order buyProduct(String id, int quantity, String userId)
      Method that uses product id, quantity, and user id to create a new Order
      Parameters:
      id - parameter that identifies the product
      quantity - parameter that identifies how much of the product has to be ordered
      userId - parameter that identifies the user placing the order
      Returns:
      Order - new instance of Order
      Since:
      1.0

    • checkAvailability

      public boolean checkAvailability(String id, String method)
      Method that can check if an order exists in three ways, through user id, product id or order id
      Parameters:
      id - parameter that identifies the order or orders we are looking for
      method - parameter that identifies the type of id we are looking for (product, order, user)
      Returns:
      boolean true if there is at least one correspondence, false otherwise
      Since:
      1.0

    • checkProductAvailability

      public boolean checkProductAvailability(String id, boolean empty)
      Method that checks if a product exists in the storage and if its quantity is more than 0 or equal to 0
      Parameters:
      id - parameter that identifies the product to look for
      empty - parameter boolean that modifies the return of the function, if true the function will check for an out-of-stock product (quantity zero), more than 0 otherwise
      Returns:
      boolean true if the product exist and is more than zero (with empty false) or equal to zero (with empty true), false otherwise
      Since:
      1.0

    • getOutOfStocks

      public HashMap<Product,Integer> getOutOfStocks()
      Method that return just the items out of stocks, with quantity equal to zero
      Returns:
      HashMap<Product, Integer> - map of out of stock products
      Since:
      2.0

    • printStorage

      public void printStorage(String type)
      Method that prints the storage map in three possible ways based upon the type parameter
      Parameters:
      type - parameter that identifies if all the products need to be printed or just the available or the out-of-stock ones
      Since:
      1.0
